metadata.title: CVE-2023-29402 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
The go command may generate unexpected code at build time when using cgo.This may result in unexpected behavior when running a go program which usescgo. This may occur when running an untrusted module which containsdirectories with newline characters in their names. Modules which areretrieved using the go command, i.e. via "go get", are not affected(modules retrieved using GOPATH-mode, i.e. GO111MODULE=off, may beaffected).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29402` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.17 - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
golang-1.17-go - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
golang-1.17-src - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2').
golang-1.18 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.20 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
